Modern History.subject: Modern History
Modern History.question: Henry T. Colebrooke was a Professor of Sanskrit in which one of the following institutions?
Modern History.explanation: Rightly described as "the first great Sanskrit scholar in Europe", H.T. Colebrooke was one of the founders of the Royal Asiatic Society in Bengal.

Modern History.subject: Modern History
Modern History.question: The Damin-i-Koh was created by the British Government to settle which one of the following communities?
Modern History.explanation: Damin-i-Koh was the land allocated to the Santhals. The Santhals could live on the land and practise plough agriculture, thus helping them to carry out settled agriculture.

Modern History.subject: Modern History
Modern History.question: The Limitation Law, which was passed by the British in 1859, addressed which one of the following issues?
options: Loan bonds would not have any legal validity.
Loan bonds signed between moneylender and Ryots would have validity only for three years.
Land bonds could not be excuted by moneylenders.
Loan bonds would have validity for ten years.
Modern History.answer: Loan bonds signed between moneylender and Ryots would have validity only for three years.
Modern History.explanation: In 1859, the British passed a Limitation Law that stated that the loan bonds signed between moneylenders and ryots would have validity for only three years.

Modern History.subject: Modern History
Modern History.question: Who among the following was known during the days of the Revolt of 1857 as ‘Danka Shah’?
Modern History.explanation: Ahmadullah Shah, famous as Maulavi of Faizabad, was one of the leading figures of the Indian Rebellion of 1857. He was known by other names of Danka Shah and Nakkaar Shah.

Modern History.subject: Modern History
Modern History.question: The Summary Settlement of 1856 was based on which one of the following assumptions?
options: The Talukdars were the rightful owners of the land.
The Talukdars were interlopers with no permanent stakes in the land.
The Talukdars could evict the peasants from the lands.
The Talukdars would take portion of the revenue which flowed to the State.
Modern History.answer: The Talukdars were interlopers with no permanent stakes in the land.
Modern History.explanation: After annexation, the first British revenue settlement, known as the Summary Set-tlement of 1856, was based on the assumption that the taluqdars were interlopers with no permanent stakes in land: they had established their hold over land through force and fraud.

Modern History.subject: Modern History
Modern History.question: Which European ruler has observed, “Bear in mind that the commerce of India is the commerce of the world... he who can exclusively command it is the dictator of Europe”?
Modern History.explanation: Peter the Great of Russia was led to exclaim: "Bear in mind that the commerce of India is the commerce of the world and … he who can exclusively command it is the dictator of Europe."

Modern History.subject: Modern History
Modern History.question: Which European traveller had observed, “A Hindu woman can go anywhere alone, even in the most crowded places, and she need never fear the impertinent looks and jokes of idle loungers”?

Modern History.subject: Modern History
Modern History.question: Which one of the following is not a change brought about by the Indian Independence Act of 1947?
options: The Government of India Act, 1935 was amended to provide an interim Constitution.
India ceased to be a dependency.
The Crown was the source of authority till new Constitution was framed.
The Governor-General was the constitutional head of Indian Dominion.
Modern History.answer: The Crown was the source of authority till new Constitution was framed.
Modern History.explanation: With Indian Independence Act of 1947, the crown was no longer the source of authority.

Modern History.subject: Modern History
Modern History.question:
Which of the following statements about Alladi Krishnaswami Ayyar, as a drafting member of the Constitution of India, are correct?
1. He favoured the role of the supreme court in tasking important decision related to the interpretation of the constitution of India..
2. He felt that the Supreme Court had to draw the line between liberty and social control.
3. He believed in the dominance of the executive over the Judiciary.
4. He favoured a dictatorial form of governance.
Select the correct answer using the code below.
Modern History.explanation: Dewan Bahadur Sir Alladi Krishnaswamy Iyer (14 May 1883 - 3 October 1953) was an Indian lawyer and member of the Constituent Assembly of India, which was responsible for framing the Constitution of India. He had ultimate faith in Democratic form of government and was a supporter of separation of executive, legislature and judiciary.

Modern History.subject: Modern History
Modern History.question: In 1921, during which one of the following tours, Gandhiji shaved his head and began wearing loincloth in order to identify with the poor?
Modern History.explanation: In 1921, during a tour of South India, Gandhiji shaved his head and began wearing a khadi dhoti, rather than he had mill-made cloth imported from abroad, in order to identify with the poor. Gandhiji encouraged other nationalist leaders who dressed in western clothes to adopt Indian attire.

Modern History.subject: Modern History
Modern History.question: Simla was founded as a hill station to use as strategic place for billeting troops, guarding frontier and launching campaign during the course of
Modern History.explanation: Hill stations were a distinctive feature of colonial urban development. They became strategic places for billeting troops, guarding frontiers and launching campaigns against enemy rulers. Simla (present day Shimla) was founded during the course of the Gurkha War (1815-16).

Modern History.subject: Modern History
Modern History.question: Which politician in British India had opposed to a Pakistan that would mean “Muslim Raj he re and Hindu Raj elsewhere”?
Modern History.explanation: "A Muslim Raj here and a Hindu Raj elsewhere, if that is what Pakistan means, I will have nothing to do with it." Sikander Hayat Khan was opposed to the partition of India.

Medieval History.subject: Medieval History
Medieval History.question: Which Arab scientist could be given the credit of christening the mathematical discipline of algorithm?
Medieval History.explanation: Muhammad ibn Musa al-Khwarizmi, formerly Latinized as Algorithmi, was a Persian scholar who produced works in mathematics, astronomy, and geography. He is given the credit of christening the mathematical discipline of algorithm.
